questions.text: The episode opens with Oliver having a hallucination. What previously deceased character is he engaged to in the dream?
questions.explanation:
Laurel Lance.

	The scene opened with Oliver on a run, then he walked into a large house where a woman is in the shower. He hands her a towel and out stepped Laurel Lance, who had died in an earlier season. During the scene he asked her to marry him, and she said she'd already answered that while showing off a ring.

questions.text: What item of Oliver's did Vibe use to find the kidnapped heroes?
questions.explanation:
Broken bow and arrow.

	Vibe, or Cisco Ramon can tell an object or its owners past and future from touching it. Oliver along with several other members of the combined team were kidnapped in "The Flash" episode that started the crossover story. The kidnapped team members were all hooked in pods and sharing a hallucination that included many characters from the show's past. Not only was this the second of a three-part four show crossover show, it was also the 100th episode of "Arrow".

questions.text: What is the name of the timeship used by the members of the Legends team?
questions.explanation:
Waverider.

	Most of the team from the four shows that crossed over with each other gathered on the Waverider after they all escaped from the Dominators. On the ship they started to figure out why they were all kidnapped.

questions.text: John Diggle was the hero known as The Hood during the shared hallucination.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Each person was living a dream that they would have liked in an alternate reality. Oliver had never become The Hood (Precursor to being the Green Arrow) and instead Diggle became the hero, with Oliver never becoming a fighter of any sort.

questions.text: Which member of "Team Arrow" thought it was awesome to meet The Flash?
questions.explanation:
Ragman.

	He said as much to The Flash during a mission. Barry Allen (The Flash) responded only to say "Wait until you meet her", just as Supergirl flew into the scene.

questions.text: Which villain didn't appear in the shared hallucinations?
questions.explanation:
Reverse Flash.

	Malcolm Merlin, Deathstroke and Damien Darhk all showed up to stop the heroes from escaping the hallucination. Eventually all three were defeated and the captives escaped in a shuttle pod.

questions.text: What is the name of the cyborg that Wild Dog, Ragman, The Flash and Supergirl fought?
questions.explanation:
Doctor Washington.

	She had been stealing technology and turning herself into a cyborg for awhile, though no exact timeframe was given. She has stolen a piece of tech that the team needed to stop the Dominators and therefore had to be confronted. She was played by Erica Luttrell. While Ragman was in the scene when they arrived to confront Washington, he wasn't part of the fight against her.

questions.text: Were the heroes able to hack into the alien technology?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	At first they thought they had only gotten a bunch of gibberish out of the alien mainframe, but they they realized the language was based on an old Hebrew dialect that converted letters to numbers. After translating it Felicity realized the captives weren't on Earth, but on the alien ship orbiting the planet.

questions.text: What was the name of the building that Diggle and Oliver both realized was fake in the hallucination?
questions.explanation:
Smoak Industries.

	Smoak industries never existed, but it was a reference to Felicity Smoak, who was a member of "Team Arrow" outside of the hallucination. They realized that in order to escape they likely needed to get to that building.

questions.text: Who "flew" the shuttle the team stole during their escape?
questions.explanation:
Thea.

	Thea was the first to figure out how to power up the ship, and it took off based on her touching the control panel. She joked about being the one who hadn't gone to college when the ship took off. They were then rescued by the Waverider right before they were attacked by the Dominators.
